h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to change the color or disable any tabs from a project's sidebar. It would be useful to have the ability to disable the tabs as per user's requirement.

h3. Suggested Solution
- Add a setting in the project administration on how to view a project summary. I.e: Disable/enable any tabs such as: Reports, Issues, Components.
- Add a setting to customize the project sidebar option under the Look & Feel section.

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60879].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Ability to create a Snapshot/baseline of JIRA at a certain point in time. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Jira should have feature that allows to create a snapshot type of backup for JIRA version, data, attachment and plugins that can be restored any time.
For example let say We are running in JIRA version 7.0, we should able to create snapshot backup and when we are in version 7.1 we should be able to restore that snapshot backup so that we can run back in version 7.0 with all the plugins and attachment that was included in JIRA 7.0.
fields.summary: Create a Snapshot/baseline of JIRA at a certain point in time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60877].
  {panel}

h3. Summary


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Issue Navigator > Advanced
# JQL: created <= 2016-05-04
# Check the result, it does not include the issues created on 2016-05-04
# Same thing goes for "updated" and "resolved".

h3. Expected Results
Issues created/updated/resolved on the date stated should be shown.

h3. Actual Results
Only  issues created/updated/resolved on days before the date stated are shown.
 
h3. Notes
* Custom date fields are not affected.
* Date 2016-05-04 means 2016-05-04 00:00:01 behind the scene, which explains why search returns now results.
* Using *>* has the complete opposite behaviour where it includes the date as if you're using *>=*.

h3.Workaround
* Use a day after the desired date to show the issues.
* Use explicit time eg created <= '2016-05-0418:00'
* When looking for results regarding a specific date (for example, 2020/09/30), it's possible to use the following:
{code}resolved >= "2020/09/30 00:01" AND resolved <= "2020/09/30 23:59"{code}
fields.summary: System Date Fields Are Not Working Properly in JQL

The [Supported Platform page for JIRA 6.4|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html] lists Oracle 12C as a supported Oracle Version, but doesn't specify what driver version is recommended for use with this database version e.g. is 11.2.x drivers fine or only 12.x drivers?
 !Selection_070.jpg|thumbnail!

fields.summary: Specify supported Oracle Driver version to be used with Oracle 12C for JIRA 6.4 Supported Platform documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60871].
  {panel}

The documentation for [creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer] seems to have been copied from the [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Importing+data+from+CSV] document (using the JIRA Importers plugin).

However, there are several differences in functionality and behavior for using the CSV Importer vs the JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM). One example would be importing issues with Components or Labels - The JIRA Importer Plugin would create the missing entries for those fields, however, the CSV Importer will fail because the components / labels do not exist.

It would be great to have those differences documented (e.g. mentioned in the *Tips for importing CSV data into issue fields* section for each field).

Having a table / matrix with all the fields which can be imported and also how they differ on each imported would be the ideal.
fields.summary: explain differences btwn CSV importer and JIM plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60864].
  {panel}

Sometimes our users do a foolish thing like posting a password, or other private information in our JIRA.

Though the fields can be _edited_ to remove this, the old values stay in history and accessible to all. The only way to erase it is to either _delete the entire ticket_, or modify the database (and reindexing).

Confluence already allows removal of some of the earlier revisions of a page (see CONF-996). JIRA should offer the same functionality for tickets -- whoever can irreversibly delete the entire ticket, ought to be able to delete bits and pieces of it.

The _act_ of deletion should itself be recorded in the issue-history and the administrator performing such an act should have an opportunity to explain their action in a comment.
fields.summary: Ability to erase old revisions of description, comment, and other fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60861].
  {panel}

Project Category - Grouping of projects

Subcomponent - Splitting of a project into smaller manageable components

There is no ability in JIRA to search in a 'Project Category' for a 'subcomponent'

The search for subcomponent within a project is done in the following way (this exist today)

subcomponents("SUB", "Design", "true")

In subcomponents() JQL function you should define three parameters:
*+projectKey +*(String, mandatory)- key of the project to search in
*+componentName +*(String, mandatory) - name of the parent component in hierarchy
*+includeParentComponent +*(Boolean, optional, default=false) - include or skip issues for parent component name

What is needed
To be able to search a Project Category also and not just Project for componentName

Thanks,
Agnes
fields.summary: Subcomponent search in Project Category not available

At this time, the option to download an MD5 is not presented for JIRA 7.x.x : [Download JIRA Software|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download]. This is the case while downloading older versions of JIRA 7.x.x as well: https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60844].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* If a user customizes the session timeout as per [How to change the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+change+the+default+session+timeout], these changes are not reflected on the User Sessions page. 
* The session is not destroyed checking the atlassian-jira-security.log and the user does not get logged out , however on the on the User Sessions page, the session is removed and re-created automatically after 4 hours. 
* If the user is idle for more than 4 hours, the session disappears from the User Session page but does not get logged out. 
* The missing functionality is *not limited to a customized JIRA timeout, but also to standard JIRA session timeout*

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow the session in the User Session face to last as long as the time customized as per [How to change the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+change+the+default+session+timeout]
fields.summary: User session to respect the changes made to the session timeout customization.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60841].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no way of having a report generated to calculate how long an issue was in a particular status. This will help to identify best performers and issues which do not follow the correct timeline of an issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement reports that could:
* Order issues by resolution time (to identify long running/complex ones)
* Order issues by users and times they took to solve issues assigned to them. 
* Order issues by projects to identify what not keeping up with project timeline/delaying the project.

h3. Workaround 
To utilise the tab *Transitions* when viewing an issue. However, this is only available issue by issue.
fields.summary: Implement report for tracking time in status in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60838].
  {panel}

On April 26, 2016, a feature has been added to JIRA Core that shows the summary, icon and status of an issue when referencing an issue in issue descriptions or comments (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-s-new-686863216.html). The extra space this occupies messes up the flow of some descriptions and comments.

Please add the possibility (preferably on a by-user basis) to:
* either disable this feature and simply show the issue key
* or only show the new feature as a mouseover title

It also appears to be so that the shown status is based on the board column, and not the actual _Status_, which can be confusing when working with multiple statuses in a single column.

Please add the possibility (preferably on a by-user basis) to:
* either disable the shown status (when it is not applicable)
* or show the actual _Status_ field instead

Affects JIRA Cloud 1000.5.0 released on April 26, 2016.
fields.summary: Add option to disable icon and status rendering in links to other issues

Reports should include a tree-like structure to get a view of Product-Prod Hierarchy-Epics-Components-Story-Status; Basically what is linked to each other should be displayed as a Parent-Child structure and exportable

When a story is created linked to an Epic and Epic already has components, versions associated with it, we still need to add components, versions to the Story also... It should inherit the fields from the Epic it is being linked

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60832].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As covered in:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-s-new-686863216.html

as of the 26 APR 2016 update:
{quote}
Links to other JIRA issues (in the description or comments) are now rendered with an icon and status, rather than as just a plain hyperlink.
{quote}

Current behavior is either All Wiki Style render enabled or disabled, and it would be nice as an administrator to be able to configure the renderer to use either the old format (Just the hyperlinked issue number) or the new format (with an icon and status).  If you type a correctly formatted issue key into any text field in JIRA, whether it uses wiki markup or not, it will present as a link to that issue. In wiki markup it will display as a jira issue macro with the summary and issue key, in default it just shows a hyperlink displayed as the issue number


h3. Suggested Solution
Add configuration option for field render behavior for issue number mapping

h3. Workaround
Using Wiki Renderer Text Formatting Notation to generate your own text based hyperlink as detailed here:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=links
{noformat}[http://<Instance_name>.atlassian.net/browse/ISSUEKEY-123]{noformat}
fields.summary: Links to other JIRA issues (in the description or comments) are now rendered with an icon and status, rather than as just a plain hyperlink

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no notification being sent out when JIRA's heap size or DB connection pool is at the exhaustion state. 

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Workaround 
Third-party monitoring tool could be in help. Please refer to [Performance Troubleshooting Tools - Best Practice|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/performance-troubleshooting-tools-best-practice-652444218.html] for more information.
fields.summary: Send notification when the heap size or DB connection pool reaching the maximum value

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIM plugin supports JIRA Server/Cloud - Bitbucket Cloud only. During the import wizard, it will redirect users to login to Bitbucket Cloud instance. 

Also this documentation needs to be updated; [Importing Data from Bitbucket|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+Bitbucket]; needs a warning saying that the JIRA - Bitbucket import will only work if users are using Bitbucket Cloud.

*Steps to reproduce:*
* Set up a notification to be sent out whenever an issue is closed
* Close an issue automatically via a Bitbucket merge
* The notification will not be sent out

This is a major problem for us, as nearly all issues are automatically closed via the process of merging pull requests in Bitbucket. At the moment, we can't find any way to notify interested parties via email.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60821].
  {panel}

h5. Suggestion
Optionally use Bitbucket and/or Bitbucket Server to store attachments for JIRA. This would be especially beneficial for large files, with Git LFS that was recently introduced.

Through branch permissions and application links, permissions could be managed as well and many of the problems that currently exist in attachment handling in JIRA would be solved by this.

File versioning would also be solved by the basic concepts of SCM.
fields.summary: Use Bitbucket for attachment storage

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60810].
  {panel}

*Description of problem:*
In JIRA 7.1.2 Issue Type icons are being added to the issue as an attachment when a user replies to the issue created email notification. This did not occur in JIRA 6.4.13 using same configuration.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create new JIRA instance
# Configure inbound and outbound mail server
# Create business project
# Add Create or Comment mail handler with settings noted below (default settings)
# Change user profile to notify of own changes
# Create issue in test project
# Reply to issue created notification
#* During testing reply sent from Microsoft Outlook
# Attachment will appear on issue when reply comment is added

Mail handler settings: 
{noformat}
Issue Type: Task 
Bulk: ignore
CC Assignee: true
CC Watchers: false
Create Users: false
Notify Users: true
Strip Quotes: false
{noformat}

*Expected behavior:*
Issue type image is not added at attachment. This is the behavior experienced in JIRA 6.4.13 using same mail handler settings.

*Note:*
This issue is related to the Microsoft Outlook client that is being used for replying the notification email from JIRA. It is tested with JIRA 7.x and Gmail to reply the notification email and the reply does not add any atatchment.
fields.summary: Issue Type icon being attached to JIRA issue upon reply to issue notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60803].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When updating a custom fields description, it seems logical that this description would update every place that custom field is used. This is not the case.

h3. Environment

Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field
# Add a description to the field
# Add this custom field to a field configuration
# Update the description of the custom field on the custom fields page
# Look at the custom field on the field configuration


h3. Expected Results

The description of the custom field on the field configuration should be updated to match the changes made on the custom fields page

h3. Actual Results

The custom field description on the field configuration retains the original description if there is one.


h3.Workaround

The user will need to update the description of the respective field on the field configuration the field is being used on
fields.summary: Updating custom field description does not update field description on field configuration

h3. Summary
Allow customers disabling 'issue render' on comments without changing the renderer of 'Comment' to _Default Test Renderer_

h3. Expected behaviour
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-27 at 5.27.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual behaviour
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-27 at 5.26.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds
h4. Workaround 1
To display the issue as a link again:
# Edit the comment/field, etc.
# Replace the issue link:
{noformat}
ABC-123
{noformat}
#* By a link to it:
{noformat}
[ABC-123|https://instance.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123]
{noformat}
# It will become a simple link to the issue

h4. Partial Workaround 2
Change the renderer for the field to 'Default Text Renderer' in the Field Configuration for the project, which will apply to the entire project.
*The side-effect to this approach is the all the text effects, formatting, etc. for that field will stop working*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60778].
  {panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
 *Atlassian Update, May 30th, 2019:*

Hello,

This is fixed. Now, there is no error if a user is selected with uppercase characters in the username.

Thanks,
Jira cloud product management

{panel}

h3. Summary
When trying to edit an existing component to set a user with uppercase characters in their username as Component Lead for a JIRA Component, an error "The user <username> does not exist."

Users without uppercase characters in their username can be entered without problems. 
Selecting a user with uppercase characters in their username is possible when creating a new component. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud (JIRA v1000.5.0)
Works in JIRA Cloud v7.2.0-OD-03-005

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the 'Project settings' menu for a JIRA project
# Click on the 'Components' link and then click on the ... button and select *edit* for an existing component. 
# Select a user (with uppercase characters in their username) from the drop down list, and then click Save. 

!Screen Shot 2016-04-27 at 1.20.31 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The user selected from the list is saved as the component lead

h3. Actual Results
An error is displayed on screen (nothing appears in the logs):

!Screen Shot 2016-04-27 at 1.20.49 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
It is possible to edit the existing component using the REST API.
fields.summary: Unable to edit a component to set a user with uppercase characters in their username as Component Lead

  {panel}

Data put in the Description field will be lost when:

1. Clicking on Create issue in the navbar in the top of the page (opening the *Create Issue* pop-ip)
2. Input data ONLY in the Description field
3. Click on the Preview button
4. Press ESC.

The ideal behavior would be JIRA shows the default message *You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, the changes will be lost.*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60773].
  {panel}

This search should return any items:

resolvedBy != "" and status was not in (resolved)

As an item that has never been resolved should not have a resolver. However, linked issues such as "relates to" and "clones" that have been resolved are populating this attribute.

This was noticed when the search: resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints()

began returning extra items the given users had not actually touched. This can inflate and give inaccurate figures which need to be rooted out by hand or filtered with something more like:

resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints() and assignee was in (user1, user2, user3)

But this is also inaccurate as a true resolver does not necessarily possess the item when resolving.
fields.summary: resolvedBy is populating from linked issues
In "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" gadget inactive users should be clearly marked as inactive

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60769].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way to pass data like team and theme allocated to a story, from Portfolio to JIRA Agile.
h3. Suggested Solution
To have a configuration, example like Team and Theme to be passed to JIRA when creating and linking the issue.

h3. Use case
{quote}
There are various fields set in Portfolio - like Team and Theme for example.

We have added our own custom fields to JIRA for Team and Theme and we would like to set these values when the issue is created via Portfolio. We can already intercept the issue creation event in JIRA, but the data from Portfolio is not passed as part of the data received by JIRA.

Being able to expose Theme as a field in JIRA means we can then use our eazyBI plugin to do all sorts of useful analytics over our investment themes.

It also means that our business analysts don't need to manually keep 2 sets of data in sync.
{quote}
fields.summary: Passing team and theme from Portfolio to JIRA Agile

What I'm looking for would mainly be moving a bunch of sub tasks from one task to another all in one step; it's a huge waste of my time if I have to move ~30 subtasks to another task by hand.

It'd also be good to be able to convert subtasks to tasks and add a story as parent, and to be able to convert them back.

h3. Summary

When querying {{/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/multiProjectSearch}}, it's possible to get an internal server error if the query parameters indicate to start at a higher number than the amount of users there are. For example if 24 users, and you try to startAt 25 it will fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Query a project that has a small number of assignable users with a larger number than exists. For example this was reproduced with <BASE_URL>/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/multiProjectSearch?projectKeys=WITI&startAt=100&maxResults=50 on a project that had 26 assignable users.

h3. Expected Results

An empty set is returned.

h3. Actual Results

The below JSON response is returned:

{code}
{
errorMessages: [
"Internal server error"
],
errors: { }
}
{code}

And an exception is thrown:

{noformat}

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:192)
	... 4 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor.intercept(ExceptionInterceptor.java:55)

	... 15 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter$JerseyOsgiServletContainer.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:154)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:68)
	... 86 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.doFilter(JiraSecurityFilter.java:70)
	... 16 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestSeraphFilter.doFilter(RestSeraphFilter.java:37)
	... 74 filtered
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)

This appears to be due to not validating the {{startAt}} query parameter and the collection is called with a substring, so it throws an exception.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60759].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Resolution Time Gadget's Y Axis is set to measure *Days*, and this cannot be configured. If an issue is created and resolved in less than a full day, it will be represented on this gadget with a resolution time that is rounded down to 0 days. 

If the following situation occurs:

# An issue is created and resolved in less than the span of a full day
# There are no other issues resolved on that day to raise the average of all issues to *at least* 1 day 

A confusing scenario will result where the chart shows no visible measurement for the day. You cannot discern if either no issues were resolved that day, or if there are issues but they average < 1 day. For example, in the screenshot below:

 !Resolution_Time_Gadget.png|thumbnail! 

Without expanding the gadget to view the data table, you cannot see that issues were resolved on 4/20/16 and 4/21/16.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
This could be addressed by allowing the Y axis measurement to be configured for more granularity; for example, by the *Hour* rather than by the *Day*.

h3. Workaround 
None; expand the data table to view specific data.
fields.summary: Resolution Time Gadget configure Y Axis measurement metric

h3. Summary
When viewing an issue in the detail view of the Issue Navigator in Internet Explorer and Edge, all dropdown menu (More, Admin, Workflow, Export) in the issue view does not work. 

h3. Environment
* Internet Explorer 11 
* Edge - issue reported in Edge, still confirming the issue can be replicated in this browser. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA and select {{Issues}}>>{{Search for issues}}.
# Enter a query to populate a list of issues.
# Select *Detail View*.
# Click on the second or any issues in the list except the first issue.
# In the issue detail view, click on {{More}}, {{Admin}}, {{Workflow}} or {{Export}}.

h3. Expected Results
Clicking either button should provide a dropdown list of options as shown below:
!expected_more.png|thumbnail!
!expected_workflow.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The button is highlighted, but no dropdowns appear as shown in the screenshots below:
!actual_more.png|thumbnail!
!actual_workflow.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
* Refresh the page.
* Load the issue in the standard issue view allows the dropdowns to work. 
* Use Firefox or Chrome.
fields.summary: Dropdown menu in issue detail view does not work in IE 11 and Edge

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When searching for issues in the issue navigator, after clicking on any of the fields, for example projects, type, status or assignee, there is no focus on the search field that is displayed.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the issue navigator
# Click on any of the fields above (Status, Type, Assignee, Projects etc)
# Start typing immediately. 

h3. Expected Results
The auto focus will be on the search field and the user can type in whatever he wants instantly.

h3. Actual Results
There is no auto focus on the field and the user cannot type in what he wants without clicking on the search field.

h3. Notes
Not reproducible in JIRA 6.4.12. (There is auto focus on the search field right after clicking on the field)

h3.Workaround
Click on the search field manually to switch focus to it and type.
fields.summary: No auto-focus in Issue Navigator after clicking on the fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60752].
  {panel}

Hi JIRA team,

Let me introduce our problem:

We would like to take advantage of "Road map" feature in project. Found out that it is interconnected with "Fix Version/s" field.

We started to use "Fix Version/s" for marking build number (e.g. "6.1.23.0") to which the issues is fixed.
Atlassian help says this field should be used for marking mentioned, or future version to which we plan to fix this issue.

There are several build before a release is released. We may call the planned release something general like "Service Release 1 (SR1)". We plan to release SR1 let's say in Q3/2016.
 
This is where the problem lies. When we would like to take advantage of "Road Map", all "unreleased" versions are part of the roadmap. The roadmap will look as follows
* 6.1.23.0
* 6.1.24.0
* 6.1.25.0
* 6.1.26.0
* 6.1.27.0
* 6.1.28.0
* Service Release 1 (SR1)
* 6.1.29.0
* 6.1.30.0
* 6.1.31.0
* 6.1.32.0
* Service Release 2 (SR2)

Basically, we would like to be able to filter build numbers so roadmap looks as follows:
* Service Release 1 (SR1)
* Service Release 2 (SR2)

The released build for SR1 will be "6.1.28.0" (but we obviously do not know the build number upfront, we call it SR1)
The released build for SR2 will be "6.1.32.0"(but we obviously do not know the build number upfront, we call it SR1)

We understand, that we may be able to set build numbers "Release flag" and they will not be shown in "Road Map". But this is not true and we do not want to do that. These build numbers are just interim builds for testing that will never be released.

We also understand that we may "Archive" the version. But we do not want to do that as well as archived versions cannot be searched for using Basic filter in JIRA. It is still available using JQL in advanced filter, but not all users are capable of creating their own advanced filter.

I hope the problem is described clearly. If not, let me know and I will provide more information.
Maybe there is another way we may achieve our goal which may be articulated as follows:

* We would like to map issues to future larger releases like "Service Release (SR1)" and see "Road Map" with number of planned issues vs fixed issues. as follows:
** Service Release 1 (SR1)
** Service Release 2 (SR2)

Thank you very much in advance
fields.summary: "Fix Version/s" vs "Road Map"

h3.Workaround

Using Chrome or Firefox click on the *X* icon to delete the Application Link, right click on the *Confirm* button, click on *Inspect Element* and locate  the following string:

{quote}
<button class="button-panel-button wizard-submit" disabled="disabled">. 
{quote}

Remove the *disabled="disabled"* (right click on it and hit delete) and click on *Confirm* again, the Application Link should be deleted properly.

h3. Problem Definition
At this moment it is not easily possible to switch easily between JIRA workflow versions. When workflows are changed, there is only the possibility to copy them and then write a version number or label into the name label (or the description of course).

h3. Suggested Solution
 
What we would like to have, is a version control for the workflows. So there should be a distinct field "version" or something similar. In Addition a function to revert to the last version (or any version prior to the current version) is also nice.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator I would like to have Workflow versioning in JIRA

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. +Summary+
User requests to configure the behavior of Quick Search box to allow numbers to be treated as character strings so that the search works without relying on users being aware of wildcards or quotations. The reason behind is inexperienced users are not aware of wildcards or quotations when using [Quick Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER071/Quick+searching].

h3. +Suggestion+
When numbers are entered into the Quick Search box, if issue keys are not found, JIRA will automatically treat them as [Free-text searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER071/Quick+searching#Quicksearching-freetextsearchingFree-textsearching].

h3. +Workaround+
Putting the numbers inside double quotes forces JIRA to treat them as character strings e.g. "123".

h3. +Related links+
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/87363/how-do-i-search-for-just-a-number-not-a-ticket-number-in-the-quick-search-box
fields.summary: Search numbers from summary, description, and comments without using wildcards or quotations in Quick Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60731].
  {panel}

As noted by some previous user suggestions, JIRA dialogs:
* Often make poor use of larger displays - restricting users to small entry fields and leaving much screen space unused (JRA-34660, JRA-40481) 
* Are not resizable or movable (JRA-37125)
* Do not provide any means for admins to customize their size/layout.

I think your users in general would be happy to see all dialogs increased in size (width), but being able to resize (or maximize) a dialog to all/most of the screen would be great!

Some particular ones that we think are too narrow:
* Create/Edit issue screen.
* Edit comment screen narrower than create issue screen (why?)
* Link issue screen (given it includes a comment box)
fields.summary: Dialog boxes should either be re-sizeable or admin configurable

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60727].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It has been seen customers creating Mail Handler for JIRA ServiceDesk in JIRA Core. Perhaps some because of lack of information and some because JIRA Core mail handler has more options.

At first place it seems that the setup is working fine by configuring a Core mail handler for ServiceDesk projects, but JIRA ServiceDesk project has its own configuration such as permission, notification, and also mail handler (which is tied to automation) that are tailored towards the simplicity of the Service Desk application. Therefore, customers will face different issues in future which is not very easy to find the root cause of those.

h3. Suggested Solution

Prevent users to choose ServiceDesk projects in JIRA Core incoming mail
fields.summary: Prevent Users To Create Mail Handlers For JIRA ServiceDesk In JIRA Core

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60720].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The "permission" column is showing NULL values from the "schemepermissions" table. This column seems to be normally NULL for any permission scheme apart from Default Permission Scheme or Global Permissions. Although, the table is used to track both Global and Project permissions, the permission column used to only be applicable to the global, default or inbuilt permission schemes.

h3. Suggested Solution

If JIRA can have a better table to track the Default Global Permissions or Permission Scheme value instead of leaving permission as NULL then would be great for easy to track instead of populate permission with NULL value when new Permission Scheme are created.
fields.summary: Improve the permission column values

h5. Problem
As [mentioned in a related bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/HCPUB-468], certain workflow transitions will not trigger a notification in HipChat. The [related documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-jira-with-hipchat-296093745.html] however fails to mention these exceptions and may set false expectations on how the integration works at the moment.

h5. Proposed solution
Mention the related bug and the effect of it on the integration as a note to avoid confusion, until the bug is fixed: [Configuring JIRA with HipChat|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-jira-with-hipchat-296093745.html].

If a user mentions themselves in a JIRA issue they should not be notified.

Steps to reproduce:
1. set your "My Changes" notification preferences to "Do not notify me"
2. create an issue
3. comment on the issue mentioning your current user.
4. Observe that you will be notified that your user mentioned your user in the issue.

h3. Problem Definition

Based on this document: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/advanced-searching-179442050.html#AdvancedSearching-Type

'was' is not a valid operator for issuetype

h3. Suggested Solution
Add 'was' operator for issue type as this would allow reporting on past issue types. 

h3. Workaround 
Using the the JIRA Suite Utilities plugin it's possible to use the Copy Value From Other Field Post-Function, allowing JIRA to be setup in the following manner:

    Remove the Issue Type field from the default screen scheme, disabling users ability to edit an issue type normally.
    Add a workflow step to change the issue type.
    This step will use the JIRA Suite Utilities post-function to set the old Issue Type in the Custom Field.
fields.summary: Add 'was' operator to issuetype for JQL search

Case:
* open an Issue
* start editing the description, directly on Issue page
* write something there
* press ESC (accidentally). While i say accidentally is because in my case some other application (not web) popped up (e.g. outlook notification popup) and i wanted to ESC-close that popup. When pressing ESC the popup was closed but chrome's JIRA page also received that event so it also canceled my whole editing.

Suggestion: when pressing ESC in quick editing mode, if i edited something, pls ask me first, before cancelling.

  {panel}

Jira Version: v7.0.2
Tomcat 7

We has use OWASP to scan JIRA server and generate report.
The report show some risk on JIRA as below:
1. X-Frame-Options Header Not Set
2. Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set
3. Cookie set without HttpOnly flag
4. Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled
5. Password Autocomplete in browser
6. X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing

How to solve this problem?
Which JIRA version doesn't have this problem?
fields.summary: X-Frame-Options Header Risk (scan from OWASP)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Attaching images using CTRL + V does not consistently bring up the Attach Screenshot popup dialogue to allow upload. 

h3. Environment
* Windows OS  
* Safari OS
* Firefox - Inconsistent
* Chrome - Inconsistent
* IE 11 - Inconsistent

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an Issue
# Copy an image to your clipboard
# Click on JIRA to bring the page in focus
# Use CTRL+ V to attach image
# If the Attach ScreenShot dialogue pops, click Cancel and repeat step 4
# If no dialogue box appears repeat step 4 (In Firefox and IE, this may take 15+ pastes)

h3. Expected Results
On first CTRL+V the Attach ScreenShot dialogue should appear and the copied image will be shown in the dialogue


h3. Actual Results
Attach ScreenShot Dialogue randomly appears, if it appears at all. The following error message can be found in the Network Profiler
{noformat}
SyntaxError: JSON.parse: unexpected end of data at line 1 column 1 of the JSON data
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround
Attach Image by either the Drag and Drop method or by clicking More > Attach File
fields.summary: Attaching Images with Keyboard Shortcuts (Ctrl + V) into Issues is Inconsistent/Broken
